ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī in the hall with the peaked roof in the Great Wood.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were having blankets made entirely of black wool.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.3_0: People who were walking about the dwellings saw this, and they complained and criticized them,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.4_0: “How can the Sakyan ascetics have blankets made entirely black wool? They are just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.5_0: The monks heard the complaints of those people
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.6_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.7_0: “How can the monks from the group of six have blankets made entirely of black wool?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.8_0: After criticizing those monks in many ways, they told the Buddha ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.9_0: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.12_0: How can you have blankets made entirely of black wool?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.13_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.14_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:1.15.1_0: ‘If a monk has a blanket made entirely of black wool, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.4_0: ...The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.6_0: there are two kinds of black:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.9_0: it is made by strewing, not by weaving.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.11_0: if he makes one or has one made, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.12_0: When he gets the robe-cloth, it becomes subject to relinquishment.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.13_0: The blanket should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.14_0: “And, monks, it should be relinquished like this. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.16_0: ‘Venerables, this blanket which I had made entirely of black wool is to be relinquished.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.17_0: I relinquish it to the Sangha.’ ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.20_0: ‘I give this robe-cloth back to you.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.21.1_0: If he finishes what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.22_0: If he finishes what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.23_0: If he finishes himself what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.24_0: If he has others finish what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.25_0: If he makes one, or has one made, for someone else, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.26_0: If she obtains one that was made by someone else and then uses it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.27.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.28_0: if she makes a canopy, a floor cover, a cloth screen, a mattress, or a pillow;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.30_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np12:2.31_0: The second rule, the training rule on entirely black, is finished.
